text:
Jiří Hanák (27 February 1938 – 5 June 2020) was a Czech journalist and political activist. He was born in Buchlovice, Czechoslovakia. He was a member of the Communist Party. He was the editor of a Czech newspaper company titled "Free word". He was one of the signers of Charter 77.
Hanák died on 5 June 2020 in Prague at the age of 82.
